question: You're looking well, Dutch.
answer: It's been a long time, General.

question: We've got a real problem here, something right up your alley. Eighteen hours ago I was informed that one of our choppers, transporting three presidential cabinet members from this charming little country, was shot down... ...The pilots radioed from the ground that they were all alive. Their position was fixed by the transponder beacon onboard the chopper. Here.
answer: That's over the border, General.

question: That's the problem. Apparently they strayed off course. We're certain they've been captured by the guerrillas.
answer: What have you got in mind, General.

question: We figure we've got less than twenty-four hours to catch up with them. After that, there's not much hope. We want a rescue operation mounted tonight. That doesn't give you much time.
answer: What else it new? When do we leave?

question: You lift off in three hours. There's one other thing.
answer: What's that, General?

question: Someone else will be going in with you.
answer: You know we don't work with outsiders, General.

question: You know we don't work with outsiders, General.
answer: Last time we danced, it was Lieutenant, Schaefer.

question: Dillon, you son of a bitch.
answer: How you been, Dutch?

question: You've been pushing too many Pencils, Dillon. Had enough?
answer: No way, old buddy.

question: You never did know when to quit.
answer: That piece of work you guys pulled off at the Berlin embassy last week was really something. Blew the entry points on three floors and neutralized the opposition in eight seconds flat. Beautiful.

question: Like the old days, Dillon.
answer: Also heard that you passed on that little job in Libya.

question: Wasn't my style. We're a rescue unit, not assassins. This must be good. Big shot from the CIA, leaves his desk to come back to the bush. What's so important?
answer: Those cabinet members are very important to our scope of operations in this part of the world. They're about to get squeezed. We can't let that happen. I needed someone who could get the job done, quick and quiet...no screw-ups. I needed the best. The best. So, I pulled a few strings at the State Department...and here we are.

question: Go on.
answer: The set-up is simple, Dutch. One day job. We pick up their trail at the chopper, run 'em down, grab the hostages and bounce back across the border before anyone knows we were there. You've done it a hundred times. Nothing out of the ordinary.

question: Our rendezvous points and radio freqs. are indicated and fixed. AWACS contact on four hour intervals.
answer: Who's our back-up on this?

question: No such thing, old buddy. It's a one way ticket. Once we cross that border, we're on our own.
answer: This gets better by the minute.

question: Man, that's a real bad habit you've got. You don't know how much I missed this, Dutch!!! Once you get this in your blood, you never get it out!!!
answer: You never were all that smart...let's go!!!

question: You never were all that smart...let's go!!!
answer: The pilots have each got one round in the head. And whoever hit it stripped the shit out of it.

question: Took 'em out with a heat seeker.
answer: There's something else, Major...

question: Mmmnnn...?
answer: I don't think that was any ordinary army taxi... ...looks more like a surveillance bird to me.

question: What happened here, Billy?
answer: Strange, Major. There was a firefight. Shooting in all directions.

question: I can't believe Jim Hopper walked into an ambush.
answer: I don't believe he did, Sir. I couldn't find a single track. Just doesn't make sense.

question: What about the rest of Hopper's men?
answer: No sign. They never left here Major. It's like they just disappeared.

question: Payback time.
answer: You're ghostin' on me, mother fokaaa!...I don't care who you are back in the world... You give away our position again and I'll bleed you quiet and leave your fuckin' ass right here. Got it?

question: Say, Bull. What's goin' down? We got movement?
answer: No. Shithead with his trenchcoat and dee-coda-da ring was makin' enough noise to get us all waxed. I don't like that guy. Don't like him at my back. I ain't winding up like those bastards back there.

question: I know what you mean, Bull, but don't sweat it, me and 'ol 'painless' here are watchin' the front door.
answer: As always, bro...

question: You're hit. You're bleedin', man.
answer: Ain't got time to bleed. Son of a bitch's dug in like a Alabama tick... ...jack us around all day.

question: Hell, dude, we don't have all day.
answer: Shit, Pancho!!!

question: This is beautiful! More than we ever thought. We got the bastards!
answer: I think this is the one you want.

question: Two days...that's all we had. In two days, three hundred of these bastards would have been equipped with all this. After they crossed the border, it would have taken a year to stop them. We've averted a major guerrilla invasion, Dutch...
answer: It was all bullshit. All of it. From the start...you set us up, got us in here to do your dirty work.

question: That's right, I set you up. You're a veteran at this, Dutch, I had to.
answer: Why us?

question: Because I told you, you're the best. I knew you could do it but I couldn't get you in here without a cover story.
answer: What story did you give to Davis?

question: We've been lookin' for this place for months. The chopper must have gotten close when they got shot down. Hopper * was sent in to get my men. He was just doing his job. When he disappeared I had to clean this up, I had to stop there bastards. We were so close, we couldn't quit. We couldn't sleep through this one. I needed you, Dutch, can't you see that? To invade a foreign country, illegally? You lied, Dillon. Stacked the odds against us. Set us up. You could have gotten us all killed. You used to be one of us, Dillon, someone I could trust with my life... We've been through a lot together Dutch. When we were together, no * one could stop us, the hottest * Goddamned team the army ever saw. * But things changed, I woke up. We're fighting them in a dozen Goddamned countries. It's a fight we can't lose, Dutch. We're all expendable assets, can't you see that?
answer: That's your problem, Dillon. You always did put ambition before the lives of your men. My men are not expendable. I don't do this kind of work. This is your dirty little war, not mine.

question: Major, we stepped into some real shit here. I got a hook-up with aerial surveillance.
answer: Movement?

question: Guerrillas swarming like flies * all over the place. Can't be more * then one, maybe two miles away. * Place is going down, Major.
answer: How much time?

question: Half an hour, maybe less. *
answer: Tell Mac we move in five.

question: Tell Mac we move in five.
answer: She goes with us. She's too valuable. She's got to know their whole network. The whole set up. We take her with us. *

question: We take her and she'll give away our position, every chance she gets. No prisoners, Dillon.
answer: You're still under orders, Dutch. You want to make the call, or should I?

question: It's not her blood.
answer: Major, you'd better take a look at this.

question: Hawkins?
answer: I can't tell.

question: What in God's name...?
answer: I think it's Hawkins.

question: Where the hell is his body?
answer: There's no sign of it.

question: Ramirez, ask her what happened.
answer: She says...the jungle came alive, and took him...

question: We're losing the light. Mac, I want a defensive position above this ridge, mined with everything we're got.
answer: Yessir.

question: Put him in his poncho and liner and carry him back. We'll bury him in the morning.
answer: I'll take him. We've got most of the flares, frags. and two claymores just outside. Nothin's comin' close to here without trippin' on somethin'.

question: Thank you, Sergeant. I'm sorry, Bull. It's never easy. He was a good soldier.
answer: The best friend I ever had. Good-bye, Bro.

question: Mac. Who hit us today?
answer: Don't know, only saw one of 'em. Camouflaged. He was there... ...Those fucking eyes...

question: What, Sergeant?
answer: Those eyes...disappeared. But I know one thing, Major... ...I drew down and fired right at it. Capped-off two hundred rounds and then the Mini-gun; the full pack. Nothin'...nothin' on this earth could have lived...not at that range. I've got the first watch.

question: No more games.
answer: I don't know what it was. It...

question: Go on.
answer: It changes colors, like the chameleon. It uses the jungle...

question: What's you name?
answer: Anna.

question: Anna. He's hunting us. You know that?
answer: What the hell do you think you're doing?

question: We're going to need everyone. *
answer: What are you talking about? We'll be out of here in ten * minutes. *

question: We're not going. *
answer: That rendezvous is ten maybe * twelve miles, at most! We're * almost home. But the chopper * won't wait.

question: If it bleeds, we can kill it.
answer: I'm tellin' you, this little * 'boy scout' stunt is a * Godamned waste of time. * * We've got to get the hell out * of here, now, while we've still * got the chance.

question: He'll be looking for the trip wires. If we're lucky, he won't see this.
answer: Now what, Dutch. You going to send your mystery guest an invitation?

question: What'll you try next -- cheese? Satisfied? Now let's get the hell out... What is God's name...?
answer: Mac! Get Ramirez on his feet! Take the girl and get the hell out of here!

question: No way, Dutch. I'm going. You get these people and get the hell out of here.
answer: This isn't your style, Dillon.

question: Guess I've picked up some bad habits from you, Dutch. Now don't argue with me, you know I'm right. Get to that chopper and hold it for us. We'll be along.
answer: You know you can't win this one.

question: You know me, Dutch, I never did know when to quit.
answer: Dillon! I'll see you there.

question: Come on, you motherfucker!
answer: Mac?

question: Out there. Past the rocks... can you see it?
answer: I see it! We're gonna take this thing. Take a position over there. I'll work around towards you. When I flush him, you nail him...

question: ...Right, I got a score to settle for the Bro...
answer: We both got scores to settle. Mac...Mac.
